result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Must be 100% compliant.

**CORRECTED TO ADD EXPUNGEMENT LANGUAGE**
Concurrent with: 15CF801

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No controlled substances except by prescription. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. No contact with the victims. May not associate with members of the Gangster Disciples or the Dirty P gang unless they are a member of the defendant's family. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Body armor warning given. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
the balance is stayed
Concurrent with: 15CF801

to be completed during the term of probation
Concurrent with: 15CF801

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
**ELIGIBLE FOR CIP AFTER SERVING 2 1/2 YEARS.**

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including anger management, domestic abuse treatment program and psych evaluation, with particular attention to PTSD. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned

Defendant Brandon C Williams in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Brandon C Williams in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
PSI reviewed by parties, no additions or corrections made.
Revocation packet also reviewed in 15CF801 & 15CF1801, no additions or corrections made.

17CF664
BTC: Ct. 1: I/S 7 yrs., 4 yrs. IC, 3 yrs. ES, 4 yrs. probation, consecutive to 15CF1801.
Ct. 3: 2 yrs., 1 yr. IC, 1 yr. ES, consecutive to 15CF1801.

15CF801
BTC: Ct. 1: 1 yr. RCJ, concurrent to 15CF1801, 169 days CFTS..

15CF1801
BTC: Ct. 1: 3 yrs., 1 1/2 yrs. IC, 1 1/2 yrs. ES, 424 days CFTS.
Ct. 2: 4 yrs., 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs. ES, consecutive to Ct. 1.

Conditions:
6 mos. RCJ, stayed, as to 17CF664, to be used at agent's discretion.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Anger management.
Domestice abuse treatment program.
Psych evaluation, with particular attention to PTSD.
Pay all courts costs, costs of supervision, surcharges.
DNA sample.
No contact with victim until such time which may be approved by the agent.

Eligible for CIP after serving 2 1/2 yrs.
Not eligible for SAP.

FAW/VOTE.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 19, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon C Williams in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Defendant Brandon C Williams in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Parties req PLEAH.
Def req bond mod.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod denied.
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

AMENDED 3/8/16:  CONDITIONS REMAIN
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Brandon C Williams in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  States offer is withdrawn as def. is non compliant with house arrest.  State requests bond review and new bond to be set at $5,000C.  bond is revoked on both files.  $5,000C bond on each file.  Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

**TAKEN INTO CUSTODY**
